chargeHist.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC
Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Jeffery J Wilson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffery J Wilson was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Jury Instructions
Court's Voir Dire

8:38 am State by DA Gerol. Defendant in person and by Atty Guza. Motions before trial.
9:24 am Jurors sworn; 20 jurors called to jury box
9:26 am Voir dire by the Court
9:52 am Voir dire by the State
10:07 am Voir dire by the Defense
10:17 am Striking of Jury
10:23 am Jury panel of 12 selected; remaining jurors thanked and excused
10:27 am Jury panel sworn; Preliminary instructions by the Court
10:37 am Jury excused; Court stand in recess
11:02 am Case recalled; same appearances; Jury panel brought in
11:06 am Opening by State
11:19 am Opening by Defense
11:25 am T.H. sworn and testified
11:33 am A.S. sworn and testified
11:50 am Jury excused; arguments heard outside of Jury's presence; Court stands in recess
1:00pm (clerk D.A.) In session, arguments heard outside the Jury's presence
1:08pm Jury brought in, 
1:09pm J.E. sworn and testified
1:25pm Sgt. B. Heinen sworn and testified. Exhibits 1-4 & 6-8 published to the jury.  Exh #12 DVD played (stop time 3:54pm)
2:14pm E.O. sworn and testified
2:41pm State rests. Jury out for break. Court remains in session and places sidebar on the record. Court in recess.
2:56pm In session outside the presence of the jury. Coleque given to defendant regarding his right not to testify. Jury instruction conference held
3:41pm Jury brought in. Defense rests. 
3:43pm Jury instructions given by the court
4:05pm Closing by State
4:19pm Closing by Defense
4:30pm Rebuttal by State
4:37pm Remaining instructions read by the Court
4:45pm Jury out to deliberate. Court in recess.
5:30pm In session. Jury brought in with verdicts of:  Count 1:  Not Guilty;    Count 2:  Not Guilty;       Count 3:  Guilty;    Count 4: Guilty 
5:37pm Jury thanked and excused. State requests  judgment on the verdicts. Court enters judgment on the two guilty verdicts. State gives recommendation. Statement by counsel and defendant. Court renders sentence.

Preliminary hearing at 07-28-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Jeffery J Wilson in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Defendant in custody. Patricia Clare Bradford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint. Atty Perez Reyes requests bail motion reduction. State opposes request. Court denies request for reduction.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. SCRAM same day as posting bail.

Defendant Jeffery J Wilson in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Defendant in custody. Patti Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint. Def does not qualify for public defender.   Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. State requests $25,000 cash bail with conditions. Atty Perez Reyes requests high signature bond or low cash bail.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
